post.description:
Process a user message and return the agent's response.
This endpoint accepts a message from a user and processes it through the agent.
It will stream the steps of the response always, and stream the tokens if 'stream_tokens' is set to True.

Asynchronously process a user message and return a run object.
The actual processing happens in the background, and the status can be checked using the run ID.

Get the status of a run.

get.description:
Get messages associated with a run with filtering options.

Args:
    run_id: ID of the run
    before: A cursor for use in pagination. `before` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, starting with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include before=obj_foo in order to fetch the previous page of the list.
    after: A cursor for use in pagination. `after` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include after=obj_foo in order to fetch the next page of the list.
    limit: Maximum number of messages to return
    order: Sort order by the created_at timestamp of the objects. asc for ascending order and desc for descending order.
    role: Filter by role (user/assistant/system/tool)
    return_message_object: Whether to return Message objects or LettaMessage objects
    user_id: ID of the user making the request

Returns:
    A list of messages associated with the run. Default is List[LettaMessage].

parameters.name: before

schema.description: Cursor for pagination
schema.title: Before

parameters.description: Cursor for pagination

schema.title: After

    after: A cursor for use in pagination. `after` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include after=obj_foo in order to fetch the next page of the list.
    limit: Maximum number of steps to return
    order: Sort order by the created_at timestamp of the objects. asc for ascending order and desc for descending order.

Returns:
    A list of steps associated with the run.

message_buffer_autoclear.title: Message Buffer Autoclear
message_buffer_autoclear.description: If set to True, the agent will not remember previous messages (though the agent will still retain state via core memory blocks and archival/recall memory). Not recommended unless you have an advanced use case.

multi_agent_group.description: The multi-agent group that this agent manages

AgentState.title: AgentState
AgentState.description:
Representation of an agent's state. This is the state of the agent at a given time, and is persisted in the DB backend. The state has all the information needed to recreate a persisted agent.

Parameters:
    id (str): The unique identifier of the agent.
    name (str): The name of the agent (must be unique to the user).
    created_at (datetime): The datetime the agent was created.
    message_ids (List[str]): The ids of the messages in the agent's in-context memory.
    memory (Memory): The in-context memory of the agent.
    tools (List[str]): The tools used by the agent. This includes any memory editing functions specified in `memory`.
    system (str): The system prompt used by the agent.
    llm_config (LLMConfig): The LLM configuration used by the agent.
    embedding_config (EmbeddingConfig): The embedding configuration used by the agent.

AgentType.title: AgentType
AgentType.description: Enum to represent the type of agent.

content.title: Content
content.description: The message content sent by the agent (can be a string or an array of content parts)

AssistantMessage.title: AssistantMessage
AssistantMessage.description:
A message sent by the LLM in response to user input. Used in the LLM context.

Args:
    id (str): The ID of the message
    date (datetime): The date the message was created in ISO format
    name (Optional[str]): The name of the sender of the message
    content (Union[str, List[LettaAssistantMessageContentUnion]]): The message content sent by the agent (can be a string or an array of content parts)

password.title: Password
password.description: Admin password provided when starting the Letta server

is_admin.description: Whether the user is an admin

is_template.description: Whether the block is a template (e.g. saved human/persona options).

label.description: Label of the block (e.g. 'human', 'persona') in the context window.

id.description: The human-friendly ID of the Block

organization_id.title: Organization Id

created_by_id.description: The id of the user that made this Block.

last_updated_by_id.title: Last Updated By Id
last_updated_by_id.description: The id of the user that last updated this Block.

Block.title: Block
Block.description:
A Block represents a reserved section of the LLM's context window which is editable. `Block` objects contained in the `Memory` object, which is able to edit the Block values.

Parameters:
    label (str): The label of the block (e.g. 'human', 'persona'). This defines a category for the block.
    value (str): The value of the block. This is the string that is represented in the context window.
    limit (int): The character limit of the block.
    is_template (bool): Whether the block is a template (e.g. saved human/persona options). Non-template blocks are not stored in the database and are ephemeral, while templated blocks are stored in the database.
    label (str): The label of the block (e.g. 'human', 'persona'). This defines a category for the block.
    template_name (str): The name of the block template (if it is a template).
    description (str): Description of the block.
    metadata (Dict): Metadata of the block.
    user_id (str): The unique identifier of the user associated with the block.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the block if it is a template.

is_template.title: Is Template
is_template.description: Whether the block is a template (e.g. saved human/persona options).

label.title: Label
label.description: Label of the block (e.g. 'human', 'persona') in the context window.

tool_name.title: Tool Name
tool_name.description: The name of the tool. Must exist in the database for the user's organization.

children.title: Children
children.description: The children tools that can be invoked.

ChildToolRule.title: ChildToolRule
ChildToolRule.description: A ToolRule represents a tool that can be invoked by the agent.

tool_name.title: Tool Name
tool_name.description: The name of the tool. Must exist in the database for the user's organization.

default_child.title: Default Child
default_child.description: The default child tool to be called. If None, any tool can be called.

child_output_mapping.title: Child Output Mapping
child_output_mapping.description: The output case to check for mapping

require_output_mapping.title: Require Output Mapping
require_output_mapping.description: Whether to throw an error when output doesn't match any case

ConditionalToolRule.title: ConditionalToolRule
ConditionalToolRule.description: A ToolRule that conditionally maps to different child tools based on the output.

context_window_size_max.title: Context Window Size Max
context_window_size_max.description: The maximum amount of tokens the context window can hold.

context_window_size_current.title: Context Window Size Current
context_window_size_current.description: The current number of tokens in the context window.

num_messages.title: Num Messages
num_messages.description: The number of messages in the context window.

num_archival_memory.title: Num Archival Memory
num_archival_memory.description: The number of messages in the archival memory.

num_recall_memory.title: Num Recall Memory
num_recall_memory.description: The number of messages in the recall memory.

num_tokens_external_memory_summary.title: Num Tokens External Memory Summary
num_tokens_external_memory_summary.description: The number of tokens in the external memory summary (archival + recall metadata).

external_memory_summary.title: External Memory Summary
external_memory_summary.description: The metadata summary of the external memory sources (archival + recall metadata).

num_tokens_system.title: Num Tokens System
num_tokens_system.description: The number of tokens in the system prompt.

system_prompt.title: System Prompt
system_prompt.description: The content of the system prompt.

num_tokens_core_memory.title: Num Tokens Core Memory
num_tokens_core_memory.description: The number of tokens in the core memory.

core_memory.title: Core Memory
core_memory.description: The content of the core memory.

num_tokens_summary_memory.title: Num Tokens Summary Memory
num_tokens_summary_memory.description: The number of tokens in the summary memory.

summary_memory.title: Summary Memory
summary_memory.description: The content of the summary memory.

num_tokens_functions_definitions.title: Num Tokens Functions Definitions
num_tokens_functions_definitions.description: The number of tokens in the functions definitions.

functions_definitions.title: Functions Definitions
functions_definitions.description: The content of the functions definitions.

num_tokens_messages.title: Num Tokens Messages
num_tokens_messages.description: The number of tokens in the messages list.

messages.title: Messages
messages.description: The messages in the context window.

ContextWindowOverview.title: ContextWindowOverview
ContextWindowOverview.description: Overview of the context window, including the number of messages and tokens.

tool_name.title: Tool Name
tool_name.description: The name of the tool. Must exist in the database for the user's organization.

ContinueToolRule.title: ContinueToolRule
ContinueToolRule.description: Represents a tool rule configuration where if this tool gets called, it must continue the agent loop.

memory_blocks.title: Memory Blocks
memory_blocks.description: The blocks to create in the agent's in-context memory.

tools.title: Tools
tools.description: The tools used by the agent.

tool_ids.title: Tool Ids
tool_ids.description: The ids of the tools used by the agent.

source_ids.title: Source Ids
source_ids.description: The ids of the sources used by the agent.

block_ids.title: Block Ids
block_ids.description: The ids of the blocks used by the agent.

tool_rules.title: Tool Rules
tool_rules.description: The tool rules governing the agent.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: The tags associated with the agent.

system.title: System
system.description: The system prompt used by the agent.

llm_config.description: The LLM configuration used by the agent.

embedding_config.description: The embedding configuration used by the agent.

initial_message_sequence.title: Initial Message Sequence
initial_message_sequence.description: The initial set of messages to put in the agent's in-context memory.

include_base_tools.title: Include Base Tools
include_base_tools.description: If true, attaches the Letta core tools (e.g. archival_memory and core_memory related functions).

include_multi_agent_tools.title: Include Multi Agent Tools
include_multi_agent_tools.description: If true, attaches the Letta multi-agent tools (e.g. sending a message to another agent).

include_base_tool_rules.title: Include Base Tool Rules
include_base_tool_rules.description: If true, attaches the Letta base tool rules (e.g. deny all tools not explicitly allowed).

model.title: Model
model.description: The LLM configuration handle used by the agent, specified in the format provider/model-name, as an alternative to specifying llm_config.

embedding.title: Embedding
embedding.description: The embedding configuration handle used by the agent, specified in the format provider/model-name.

context_window_limit.title: Context Window Limit
context_window_limit.description: The context window limit used by the agent.

embedding_chunk_size.title: Embedding Chunk Size
embedding_chunk_size.description: The embedding chunk size used by the agent.

max_tokens.title: Max Tokens
max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate, including reasoning step. If not set, the model will use its default value.

max_reasoning_tokens.title: Max Reasoning Tokens
max_reasoning_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate for reasoning step. If not set, the model will use its default value.

enable_reasoner.title: Enable Reasoner
enable_reasoner.description: Whether to enable internal extended thinking step for a reasoner model.

from_template.title: From Template
from_template.description: The template id used to configure the agent

template.title: Template
template.description: Whether the agent is a template

project.title: Project
project.description: Deprecated: Project should now be passed via the X-Project header instead of in the request body. If using the sdk, this can be done via the new x_project field below.

tool_exec_environment_variables.title: Tool Exec Environment Variables
tool_exec_environment_variables.description: The environment variables for tool execution specific to this agent.

memory_variables.title: Memory Variables
memory_variables.description: The variables that should be set for the agent.

project_id.title: Project Id
project_id.description: The id of the project the agent belongs to.

template_id.title: Template Id
template_id.description: The id of the template the agent belongs to.

base_template_id.title: Base Template Id
base_template_id.description: The base template id of the agent.

identity_ids.title: Identity Ids
identity_ids.description: The ids of the identities associated with this agent.

message_buffer_autoclear.title: Message Buffer Autoclear
message_buffer_autoclear.description: If set to True, the agent will not remember previous messages (though the agent will still retain state via core memory blocks and archival/recall memory). Not recommended unless you have an advanced use case.

CreateAgentRequest.title: CreateAgentRequest
CreateAgentRequest.description: CreateAgent model specifically for POST request body, excluding user_id which comes from headers

text.title: Text
text.description: Text to write to archival memory.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the block if it is a template.

timeout.title: Timeout
timeout.description: Time limit for the sandbox (in seconds).

pip_requirements.title: Pip Requirements
pip_requirements.description: A list of pip packages to install on the E2B Sandbox

embedding_endpoint_type.title: Embedding Endpoint Type
embedding_endpoint_type.description: The endpoint type for the model.

embedding_endpoint.title: Embedding Endpoint
embedding_endpoint.description: The endpoint for the model (`None` if local).

embedding_chunk_size.title: Embedding Chunk Size
embedding_chunk_size.description: The chunk size of the embedding.

handle.title: Handle
handle.description: The handle for this config, in the format provider/model-name.

azure_endpoint.title: Azure Endpoint
azure_endpoint.description: The Azure endpoint for the model.

azure_version.title: Azure Version
azure_version.description: The Azure version for the model.

azure_deployment.title: Azure Deployment
azure_deployment.description: The Azure deployment for the model.

EmbeddingConfig.title: EmbeddingConfig
EmbeddingConfig.description:
Embedding model configuration. This object specifies all the information necessary to access an embedding model to usage with Letta, except for secret keys.

Attributes:
    embedding_endpoint_type (str): The endpoint type for the model.
    embedding_endpoint (str): The endpoint for the model.
    embedding_model (str): The model for the embedding.
    embedding_dim (int): The dimension of the embedding.
    embedding_chunk_size (int): The chunk size of the embedding.
    azure_endpoint (:obj:`str`, optional): The Azure endpoint for the model (Azure only).
    azure_version (str): The Azure version for the model (Azure only).
    azure_deployment (str): The Azure deployment for the model (Azure only).

id.title: Id
id.description: The human-friendly ID of the File

organization_id.title: Organization Id
organization_id.description: The unique identifier of the organization associated with the document.

source_id.title: Source Id
source_id.description: The unique identifier of the source associated with the document.

file_type.title: File Type
file_type.description: The type of the file (MIME type).

file_size.title: File Size
file_size.description: The size of the file in bytes.

file_creation_date.title: File Creation Date
file_creation_date.description: The creation date of the file.

file_last_modified_date.title: File Last Modified Date
file_last_modified_date.description: The last modified date of the file.

updated_at.title: Updated At
updated_at.description: The update date of the file.

is_deleted.title: Is Deleted
is_deleted.description: Whether this file is deleted or not.

id.title: Id
id.description: The id of the group. Assigned by the database.

HiddenReasoningMessage.title: HiddenReasoningMessage
HiddenReasoningMessage.description:
Representation of an agent's internal reasoning where reasoning content
has been hidden from the response.

Args:
    id (str): The ID of the message
    date (datetime): The date the message was created in ISO format
    name (Optional[str]): The name of the sender of the message
    state (Literal["redacted", "omitted"]): Whether the reasoning
        content was redacted by the provider or simply omitted by the API
    hidden_reasoning (Optional[str]): The internal reasoning of the agent

InitToolRule.description: Represents the initial tool rule configuration.

id.description: The human-friendly ID of the Job

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The unique identifier of the user associated with the job.

Job.title: Job
Job.description:
Representation of offline jobs, used for tracking status of data loading tasks (involving parsing and embedding files).

Parameters:
    id (str): The unique identifier of the job.
    status (JobStatus): The status of the job.
    created_at (datetime): The unix timestamp of when the job was created.
    completed_at (datetime): The unix timestamp of when the job was completed.
    user_id (str): The unique identifier of the user associated with the.

model_endpoint_type.title: Model Endpoint Type
model_endpoint_type.description: The endpoint type for the model.

context_window.title: Context Window
context_window.description: The context window size for the model.

put_inner_thoughts_in_kwargs.title: Put Inner Thoughts In Kwargs
put_inner_thoughts_in_kwargs.description: Puts 'inner_thoughts' as a kwarg in the function call if this is set to True. This helps with function calling performance and also the generation of inner thoughts.

handle.title: Handle
handle.description: The handle for this config, in the format provider/model-name.

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description: The temperature to use when generating text with the model. A higher temperature will result in more random text.

max_tokens.title: Max Tokens
max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate. If not set, the model will use its default value.

enable_reasoner.title: Enable Reasoner
enable_reasoner.description: Whether or not the model should use extended thinking if it is a 'reasoning' style model

max_reasoning_tokens.title: Max Reasoning Tokens
max_reasoning_tokens.description: Configurable thinking budget for extended thinking, only used if enable_reasoner is True. Minimum value is 1024.

LLMConfig.title: LLMConfig
LLMConfig.description:
Configuration for a Language Model (LLM) model. This object specifies all the information necessary to access an LLM model to usage with Letta, except for secret keys.

Attributes:
    model (str): The name of the LLM model.
    model_endpoint_type (str): The endpoint type for the model.
    model_endpoint (str): The endpoint for the model.
    model_wrapper (str): The wrapper for the model. This is used to wrap additional text around the input/output of the model. This is useful for text-to-text completions, such as the Completions API in OpenAI.
    context_window (int): The context window size for the model.
    put_inner_thoughts_in_kwargs (bool): Puts `inner_thoughts` as a kwarg in the function call if this is set to True. This helps with function calling performance and also the generation of inner thoughts.
    temperature (float): The temperature to use when generating text with the model. A higher temperature will result in more random text.
    max_tokens (int): The maximum number of tokens to generate.

messages.title: Messages
messages.description: The messages to be sent to the agent.

use_assistant_message.title: Use Assistant Message
use_assistant_message.description: Whether the server should parse specific tool call arguments (default `send_message`) as `AssistantMessage` objects.

assistant_message_tool_name.title: Assistant Message Tool Name
assistant_message_tool_name.description: The name of the designated message tool.

assistant_message_tool_kwarg.title: Assistant Message Tool Kwarg
assistant_message_tool_kwarg.description: The name of the message argument in the designated message tool.

use_assistant_message.title: Use Assistant Message
use_assistant_message.description: Whether the server should parse specific tool call arguments (default `send_message`) as `AssistantMessage` objects.

assistant_message_tool_name.title: Assistant Message Tool Name
assistant_message_tool_name.description: The name of the designated message tool.

assistant_message_tool_kwarg.title: Assistant Message Tool Kwarg
assistant_message_tool_kwarg.description: The name of the message argument in the designated message tool.

messages.title: Messages
messages.description: The messages returned by the agent.

usage.description: The usage statistics of the agent.

LettaResponse.title: LettaResponse
LettaResponse.description:
Response object from an agent interaction, consisting of the new messages generated by the agent and usage statistics.
The type of the returned messages can be either `Message` or `LettaMessage`, depending on what was specified in the request.

Attributes:
    messages (List[Union[Message, LettaMessage]]): The messages returned by the agent.
    usage (LettaUsageStatistics): The usage statistics

messages.title: Messages
messages.description: The messages to be sent to the agent.

use_assistant_message.title: Use Assistant Message
use_assistant_message.description: Whether the server should parse specific tool call arguments (default `send_message`) as `AssistantMessage` objects.

assistant_message_tool_name.title: Assistant Message Tool Name
assistant_message_tool_name.description: The name of the designated message tool.

assistant_message_tool_kwarg.title: Assistant Message Tool Kwarg
assistant_message_tool_kwarg.description: The name of the message argument in the designated message tool.

stream_tokens.title: Stream Tokens
stream_tokens.description: Flag to determine if individual tokens should be streamed. Set to True for token streaming (requires stream_steps = True).

completion_tokens.title: Completion Tokens
completion_tokens.description: The number of tokens generated by the agent.

prompt_tokens.title: Prompt Tokens
prompt_tokens.description: The number of tokens in the prompt.

total_tokens.title: Total Tokens
total_tokens.description: The total number of tokens processed by the agent.

step_count.title: Step Count
step_count.description: The number of steps taken by the agent.

LettaUsageStatistics.title: LettaUsageStatistics
LettaUsageStatistics.description:
Usage statistics for the agent interaction.

Attributes:
    completion_tokens (int): The number of tokens generated by the agent.
    prompt_tokens (int): The number of tokens in the prompt.
    total_tokens (int): The total number of tokens processed by the agent.
    step_count (int): The number of steps taken by the agent.

use_venv.title: Use Venv
use_venv.description: Whether or not to use the venv, or run directly in the same run loop.

venv_name.title: Venv Name
venv_name.description: The name for the venv in the sandbox directory. We first search for an existing venv with this name, otherwise, we make it from the requirements.txt.

pip_requirements.title: Pip Requirements
pip_requirements.description: List of pip packages to install with mandatory name and optional version following semantic versioning. This only is considered when use_venv is True.

MCPTool.title: MCPTool
MCPTool.description: A simple wrapper around MCP's tool definition (to avoid conflict with our own)

tool_name.title: Tool Name
tool_name.description: The name of the tool. Must exist in the database for the user's organization.

max_count_limit.title: Max Count Limit
max_count_limit.description: The max limit for the total number of times this tool can be invoked in a single step.

MaxCountPerStepToolRule.title: MaxCountPerStepToolRule
MaxCountPerStepToolRule.description: Represents a tool rule configuration which constrains the total number of times this tool can be invoked in a single step.

blocks.title: Blocks
blocks.description: Memory blocks contained in the agent's in-context memory

prompt_template.title: Prompt Template
prompt_template.description: Jinja2 template for compiling memory blocks into a prompt string

Memory.title: Memory
Memory.description: Represents the in-context memory (i.e. Core memory) of the agent. This includes both the `Block` objects (labelled by sections), as well as tools to edit the blocks.

Message.title: Message
Message.description:
Letta's internal representation of a message. Includes methods to convert to/from LLM provider formats.

Attributes:
    id (str): The unique identifier of the message.
    role (MessageRole): The role of the participant.
    text (str): The text of the message.
    user_id (str): The unique identifier of the user.
    agent_id (str): The unique identifier of the agent.
    model (str): The model used to make the function call.
    name (str): The name of the participant.
    created_at (datetime): The time the message was created.
    tool_calls (List[OpenAIToolCall,]): The list of tool calls requested.
    tool_call_id (str): The id of the tool call.

ReasoningMessage.title: ReasoningMessage
ReasoningMessage.description:
Representation of an agent's internal reasoning.

Args:
    id (str): The ID of the message
    date (datetime): The date the message was created in ISO format
    name (Optional[str]): The name of the sender of the message
    source (Literal["reasoner_model", "non_reasoner_model"]): Whether the reasoning
        content was generated natively by a reasoner model or derived via prompting
    reasoning (str): The internal reasoning of the agent
    signature (Optional[str]): The model-generated signature of the reasoning step

data.title: Data

Run.title: Run
Run.description:
Representation of a run, which is a job with a 'run' prefix in its ID.
Inherits all fields and behavior from Job except for the ID prefix.

Parameters:
    id (str): The unique identifier of the run (prefixed with 'run-').
    status (JobStatus): The status of the run.
    created_at (datetime): The unix timestamp of when the run was created.
    completed_at (datetime): The unix timestamp of when the run was completed.
    user_id (str): The unique identifier of the user associated with the run.

key.title: Key
key.description: The name of the environment variable.

value.title: Value
value.description: The value of the environment variable.

description.title: Description
description.description: An optional description of the environment variable.

key.title: Key
key.description: The name of the environment variable.

value.title: Value
value.description: The value of the environment variable.

description.title: Description
description.description: An optional description of the environment variable.

id.title: Id
id.description: The human-friendly ID of the Source

embedding_config.description: The embedding configuration used by the source.

organization_id.title: Organization Id
organization_id.description: The ID of the organization that created the source.

created_by_id.title: Created By Id
created_by_id.description: The id of the user that made this Tool.

last_updated_by_id.title: Last Updated By Id
last_updated_by_id.description: The id of the user that made this Tool.

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: The timestamp when the source was created.

updated_at.title: Updated At
updated_at.description: The timestamp when the source was last updated.

Source.title: Source
Source.description:
Representation of a source, which is a collection of files and passages.

Parameters:
    id (str): The ID of the source
    name (str): The name of the source.
    embedding_config (EmbeddingConfig): The embedding configuration used by the source.
    user_id (str): The ID of the user that created the source.
    metadata (dict): Metadata associated with the source.
    description (str): The description of the source.

embedding.title: Embedding
embedding.description: The hande for the embedding config used by the source.

embedding_chunk_size.title: Embedding Chunk Size
embedding_chunk_size.description: The chunk size of the embedding.

embedding_config.description: (Legacy) The embedding configuration used by the source.

SourceCreate.title: SourceCreate
SourceCreate.description: Schema for creating a new Source.

embedding_config.description: The embedding configuration used by the source.

SourceUpdate.title: SourceUpdate
SourceUpdate.description: Schema for updating an existing Source.

command.title: Command
command.description: The command to run (MCP 'local' client will run this command)

args.title: Args
args.description: The arguments to pass to the command

id.title: Id
id.description: The id of the step. Assigned by the database.

origin.title: Origin
origin.description: The surface that this agent step was initiated from.

organization_id.title: Organization Id
organization_id.description: The unique identifier of the organization associated with the step.

provider_id.title: Provider Id
provider_id.description: The unique identifier of the provider that was configured for this step

job_id.title: Job Id
job_id.description: The unique identifier of the job that this step belongs to. Only included for async calls.

agent_id.title: Agent Id
agent_id.description: The ID of the agent that performed the step.

provider_name.title: Provider Name
provider_name.description: The name of the provider used for this step.

model.title: Model
model.description: The name of the model used for this step.

model_endpoint.title: Model Endpoint
model_endpoint.description: The model endpoint url used for this step.

context_window_limit.title: Context Window Limit
context_window_limit.description: The context window limit configured for this step.

completion_tokens.title: Completion Tokens
completion_tokens.description: The number of tokens generated by the agent during this step.

prompt_tokens.title: Prompt Tokens
prompt_tokens.description: The number of tokens in the prompt during this step.

total_tokens.title: Total Tokens
total_tokens.description: The total number of tokens processed by the agent during this step.

tid.title: Tid
tid.description: The unique identifier of the transaction that processed this step.

trace_id.title: Trace Id
trace_id.description: The trace id of the agent step.

messages.title: Messages
messages.description: The messages generated during this step.

content.title: Content
content.description: The message content sent by the system

SystemMessage.title: SystemMessage
SystemMessage.description:
A message generated by the system. Never streamed back on a response, only used for cursor pagination.

Args:
    id (str): The ID of the message
    date (datetime): The date the message was created in ISO format
    name (Optional[str]): The name of the sender of the message
    content (str): The message content sent by the system

tool_name.title: Tool Name
tool_name.description: The name of the tool. Must exist in the database for the user's organization.

TerminalToolRule.title: TerminalToolRule
TerminalToolRule.description: Represents a terminal tool rule configuration where if this tool gets called, it must end the agent loop.

text.title: Text
text.description: The text content of the message.

id.title: Id
id.description: The human-friendly ID of the Tool

source_type.title: Source Type
source_type.description: The type of the source code.

organization_id.title: Organization Id
organization_id.description: The unique identifier of the organization associated with the tool.

source_code.title: Source Code
source_code.description: The source code of the function.

json_schema.title: Json Schema
json_schema.description: The JSON schema of the function.

args_json_schema.title: Args Json Schema
args_json_schema.description: The args JSON schema of the function.

return_char_limit.title: Return Char Limit
return_char_limit.description: The maximum number of characters in the response.

created_by_id.title: Created By Id
created_by_id.description: The id of the user that made this Tool.

last_updated_by_id.title: Last Updated By Id
last_updated_by_id.description: The id of the user that made this Tool.

metadata_.title: Metadata
metadata_.description: A dictionary of additional metadata for the tool.

Tool.title: Tool
Tool.description:
Representation of a tool, which is a function that can be called by the agent.

Parameters:
    id (str): The unique identifier of the tool.
    name (str): The name of the function.
    tags (List[str]): Metadata tags.
    source_code (str): The source code of the function.
    json_schema (Dict): The JSON schema of the function.

type.title: Type
type.description: Indicates this content represents a tool call event.

id.title: Id
id.description: A unique identifier for this specific tool call instance.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the tool being called.

input.title: Input
input.description: The parameters being passed to the tool, structured as a dictionary of parameter names to values.

ToolCallMessage.title: ToolCallMessage
ToolCallMessage.description:
A message representing a request to call a tool (generated by the LLM to trigger tool execution).

Args:
    id (str): The ID of the message
    date (datetime): The date the message was created in ISO format
    name (Optional[str]): The name of the sender of the message
    tool_call (Union[ToolCall, ToolCallDelta]): The tool call

source_code.title: Source Code
source_code.description: The source code of the function.

source_type.title: Source Type
source_type.description: The source type of the function.

json_schema.title: Json Schema
json_schema.description: The JSON schema of the function (auto-generated from source_code if not provided)

args_json_schema.title: Args Json Schema
args_json_schema.description: The args JSON schema of the function.

return_char_limit.title: Return Char Limit
return_char_limit.description: The maximum number of characters in the response.

status.title: Status
status.description: The status of the tool call

stdout.title: Stdout
stdout.description: Captured stdout (e.g. prints, logs) from the tool invocation

stderr.title: Stderr
stderr.description: Captured stderr from the tool invocation

type.title: Type
type.description: Indicates this content represents a tool return event.

tool_call_id.title: Tool Call Id
tool_call_id.description: References the ID of the ToolCallContent that initiated this tool call.

content.title: Content
content.description: The content returned by the tool execution.

is_error.title: Is Error
is_error.description: Indicates whether the tool execution resulted in an error.

ToolReturnMessage.title: ToolReturnMessage
ToolReturnMessage.description:
A message representing the return value of a tool call (generated by Letta executing the requested tool).

Args:
    id (str): The ID of the message
    date (datetime): The date the message was created in ISO format
    name (Optional[str]): The name of the sender of the message
    tool_return (str): The return value of the tool
    status (Literal["success", "error"]): The status of the tool call
    tool_call_id (str): A unique identifier for the tool call that generated this message
    stdout (Optional[List(str)]): Captured stdout (e.g. prints, logs) from the tool invocation
    stderr (Optional[List(str)]): Captured stderr from the tool invocation

source_code.title: Source Code
source_code.description: The source code of the function.

args.title: Args
args.description: The arguments to pass to the tool.

env_vars.title: Env Vars
env_vars.description: The environment variables to pass to the tool.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the tool to run.

source_type.title: Source Type
source_type.description: The type of the source code.

args_json_schema.title: Args Json Schema
args_json_schema.description: The args JSON schema of the function.

json_schema.title: Json Schema
json_schema.description: The JSON schema of the function (auto-generated from source_code if not provided)

source_code.title: Source Code
source_code.description: The source code of the function.

source_type.title: Source Type
source_type.description: The type of the source code.

json_schema.title: Json Schema
json_schema.description: The JSON schema of the function (auto-generated from source_code if not provided)

args_json_schema.title: Args Json Schema
args_json_schema.description: The args JSON schema of the function.

return_char_limit.title: Return Char Limit
return_char_limit.description: The maximum number of characters in the response.

tool_ids.title: Tool Ids
tool_ids.description: The ids of the tools used by the agent.

source_ids.title: Source Ids
source_ids.description: The ids of the sources used by the agent.

block_ids.title: Block Ids
block_ids.description: The ids of the blocks used by the agent.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: The tags associated with the agent.

system.title: System
system.description: The system prompt used by the agent.

tool_rules.title: Tool Rules
tool_rules.description: The tool rules governing the agent.

llm_config.description: The LLM configuration used by the agent.

embedding_config.description: The embedding configuration used by the agent.

message_ids.title: Message Ids
message_ids.description: The ids of the messages in the agent's in-context memory.

tool_exec_environment_variables.title: Tool Exec Environment Variables
tool_exec_environment_variables.description: The environment variables for tool execution specific to this agent.

project_id.title: Project Id
project_id.description: The id of the project the agent belongs to.

template_id.title: Template Id
template_id.description: The id of the template the agent belongs to.

base_template_id.title: Base Template Id
base_template_id.description: The base template id of the agent.

identity_ids.title: Identity Ids
identity_ids.description: The ids of the identities associated with this agent.

message_buffer_autoclear.title: Message Buffer Autoclear
message_buffer_autoclear.description: If set to True, the agent will not remember previous messages (though the agent will still retain state via core memory blocks and archival/recall memory). Not recommended unless you have an advanced use case.

model.title: Model
model.description: The LLM configuration handle used by the agent, specified in the format provider/model-name, as an alternative to specifying llm_config.

embedding.title: Embedding
embedding.description: The embedding configuration handle used by the agent, specified in the format provider/model-name.

content.title: Content
content.description: The message content sent by the assistant (can be a string or an array of content parts)

content.title: Content
content.description: The message content sent by the system (can be a string or an array of multi-modal content parts)

content.title: Content
content.description: The message content sent by the user (can be a string or an array of multi-modal content parts)

id.title: Id
id.description: The human-friendly ID of the User

organization_id.title: Organization Id
organization_id.description: The organization id of the user

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: The creation date of the user.

updated_at.title: Updated At
updated_at.description: The update date of the user.

is_deleted.title: Is Deleted
is_deleted.description: Whether this user is deleted or not.

User.title: User
User.description:
Representation of a user.

Parameters:
    id (str): The unique identifier of the user.
    name (str): The name of the user.
    created_at (datetime): The creation date of the user.

organization_id.title: Organization Id
organization_id.description: The organization id of the user.

content.title: Content
content.description: The message content sent by the user (can be a string or an array of multi-modal content parts)

UserMessage.title: UserMessage
UserMessage.description:
A message sent by the user. Never streamed back on a response, only used for cursor pagination.

Args:
    id (str): The ID of the message
    date (datetime): The date the message was created in ISO format
    name (Optional[str]): The name of the sender of the message
    content (Union[str, List[LettaUserMessageContentUnion]]): The message content sent by the user (can be a string or an array of multi-modal content parts)

id.title: Id
id.description: The id of the user to update.

name.title: Name
name.description: The new name of the user.

organization_id.title: Organization Id
organization_id.description: The new organization id of the user.
